title: College student studying for finals gets revenge on cousin’s late-night gaming marathons by cutting the Wi-Fi at 11 pm sharp: 'She said I was acting like an old landlord'
description: There's nothing more infuriating than trying to sleep while someone else in the house is making enough noise to keep you awake. As someone who lives in the downstairs of a duplex, I know this feeling all too well. It's like trying to ignore an elephant tap-dancing above you. It's impossible. But for the guy in this story, his stress levels were already through the roof as he was prepping for finals week just around the corner. Already on edge, things took a turn for the worse when his cousin asked to crash with him for a while after landing an internship near his place. At first, he thought it was no big deal. Family's family, after all. But he instantly regretted this little arrangement when the midnight gaming marathons began. If you game yourself, you know there's no amount of earplugs or patience that can drown out loud video games, banter, and TV noise for anyone else in the household. But little did this guy know, his "easy" decision to host his cousin would lead to a battle over Wi-Fi, sleep, and sanity. So, he had to take matters into his own hands.
author: Isabella Penn

title: Restaurant employee is ostracized after speaking up about the manager's newborn baby being in the kitchen during working hours: ‘Holy OSHA violation’
description: Restaurant work, specifically, roles that exist in the kitchen, must live up to certain expectations, health codes, and standards set by the state. Without these rules and regulations, the food these restaurants serve and the safety of the kitchen staff would be put at risk. Luckily, most of those in managerial positions ensure that these rules are followed to a tee—but not all. Others believe that the regulations don't apply to them, that they are above the dangers of flames, sharp knives, and heavy cast-iron pans. When that happens, it's up to those around them to put them in check. If that fails, you go above them. The employee in this story does exactly that, but is ostracized as a result.This story proves that no matter how high a position one might be in, they prove that they don't deserve to have that power and sway. Scroll to read.
author: Lana DeGaetano

title: 22 Big Cat Memes With Big Cat Energy to Spread Around to You
description: If bug cats are not our friends, then why are they friend shaped? It's a question we wish we could answer, but we don't know how. Like many of you, cat lovers and feline fanatic fans, we consider big cats just cats, despite their size. We want to cuddle them like cats, play with them like cats, pet them like cats, and tell them they're the cutest angel we've ever seen like cats. Is this really too much to ask? We feel like nature is being unfair here. We honestly want to give love to all cats, and that includes big cats. We don't care about their teeth and claw size, they are still tiny little babies who need a scratch under their chins.And if you doubt that premise for one second, let us assure you we come with receipts. And you already know what kind of receipts we provide here around Cheezburger, in any topic - memes, and loads of them. So here we bring you the proof with big cat memes that have the same cat energy all cats have.
author: Ayala Sorotsky

title: Woman rescues her hoarder sister's senior "demon cat" after she passes, turns out the cat was only mean because he was neglected and angry, now he's clean, happy and so loving: 'I never heard him purr before.'
description: People who have never had cats in their lives have all kinds of misconceptions about them. People think that cats are aloof or that cats are mean, but that's not true. The vast majority of cats are neither of these things, and of the cats that do seem aloof or mean… there is usually a reason. If you treat a cat well, if you give them the love and respect and time that they need, usually, even the "meanest" cat will open up to you and show you affection. Today's story just reinforces this notion. A demon cat - that's what this poor little thing was called throughout his life. He was mean to everyone except for his owner and her husband. But once the owner passed and the cat was adopted by her sister, his real colors started to show. In that house, he was neglected sad, so he was "mean" to people. In his new house, he got the things that he truly needed, and just like that, he became the sweetest cuddle-bug .
author: Mariel Ruvinsky

title: The Revolution Will Be Televised
description: If they had dripped those first three episodes of Andor Season 2 out, the community would be in crisis. I understand what they were trying to do, because some aspects of it get unfolded in the second three episode arc - which is excellent and is exactly what I want. But those first three feel mostly like setup, sawdust in the flour, because that's sorta what it is.

title: Error'd: Charge Me
description: The lights are on here and the roof is intact and I'm grateful. Is anybody home? You decide. Pharm fan Ian S. clucked "Perhaps they'll put those as dates on my headstone." If you're very lucky.   An anonymous reader blew the whistle on their child labor practices. "This institution exclusively uses drivers who aren't legally old enough to drive."   Greg A. grumbled "Glad that the important notice that there was no important notice was given such prominence in the official ACT web page." I have nothing more to add.   Regular reader Michael R. reported "I can confirm Hermes knows how to navigate the unknown."   Finally, faithful follower B.J.H. has been around here long enough to see this one over and over again. "For some reason people keep thinking zip codes are numbers just because they are composed of digits. When EPIC sent paper mail asking for money in December the envelope used a zip code of 1740 (and it was delivered). They solved leading zero issue by switching to base 36." Or it might just be base 26, no way to tell.   [Advertisement] ProGet’s got you covered with security and access controls on your NuGet feeds. Learn more.
author: Lyle Seaman

title: CodeSOD: Pulling at the Start of a Thread
description: For testing networking systems, load simulators are useful: send a bunch of realistic looking traffic and see what happens as you increase the amount of sent traffic. These sorts of simulators often rely on being heavily multithreaded, since one computer can, if pushed, generate a lot of network traffic. Thus, when Jonas inherited a heavily multithreaded system for simulating load, that wasn't a surprise. The surprise was that the developer responsible for it didn't really understand threading in Java. Probably in other languages too, but in this case, Java was what they were using. public void startTraffic() { Configuration.instance.inititiateStatistics(); Statistics.instance.addStatisticListener(gui); if (t != null) { if (t.isAlive()) { t.destroy(); } } t = new Thread(this); t.start(); } Look, this is not a good way to manage threads in Java. I don't know if I'd call it a WTF, but it's very much a "baby's first threading" approach. There are better abstractions around threads that would avoid the need to manage thread instances directly. I certainly don't love situations where a Runnable also manages its own thread instance. This is almost certainly a race condition, but I don't know if this function is called from multiple threads (but I suspect it might be). But what's more interesting is where this code gets called. You see, starting a thread could trigger an exception, so you need to handle that: public void run() { while (true) { try { loaderMain.startTraffic(); break; } catch (Exception e) { System.out.println("Exception in main loader thread!"); e.printStackTrace(); } } } Inside of an infinite loop, we try to start traffic. If we succeed, we break out of the loop. If we fail, well, we try and try again and again and again and again and again and again… Jonas writes: Since I'm the only one that dares to wade through the opaque mess of code that somehow, against all odds, manages to work most of the time, I get to fix it whenever it presents strange behavior. I suspect it's going to present much more strange behavior in the future. [Advertisement] ProGet’s got you covered with security and access controls on your NuGet feeds. Learn more.

title: Study Finds Ozempic May Reduce Signs Of Fatty Liver Disease
description: A study in The New England Journal Of Medicine found that semaglutides, such as Ozempic and Wegovy, may help treat fatty liver disease, pointing to yet another potential use for these popular weight-loss drugs. What do you think? The post Study Finds Ozempic May Reduce Signs Of Fatty Liver Disease appeared first on The Onion.

title: ‘GTA VI’ Delayed Until Developers Get Grades Up
description: EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND—Scolding thousands of employees for letting themselves become distracted from their schooling, Rockstar Games announced Friday that Grand Theft Auto VI would be delayed until the studio’s developers got their grades up. “We understand how much our team wants to release a painstakingly crafted Vice City into the world, but there’s just no way […] The post ‘GTA VI’ Delayed Until Developers Get Grades Up appeared first on The Onion.

title: The Replacement Plan
description: “We had a professional family photo done for my parents Mother’s & Father’s Day but right after we gave it to them, my brother got a divorce. My dad decided to cut my ex-sister in law out of the photo and replace her with someone else. Then he hung it on the wall like this...
